sen.j: 杉浦 重剛（すぎうら じゅうごう、安政2年3月3日 (旧暦)（1855年4月19日）- 大正13年（1924年2月13日）は、明治時代・大正時代の国粋主義的教育者・思想家。
sen.e: Jugo SUGIURA (April 19, 1855 to February 13, 1924) is a nationalistic educator and thinker in the periods of Meiji and Taisho.
Jugo SUGIURA (April 19, 1855 - February 13, 1924) was a nationalistic educator and thinker of the Meiji period and the Taisho period.
sen.cmt: 用語を統一、時制を直します。
sen.e: Jugo SUGIURA (April 19, 1855 - February 13, 1924) was a nationalistic educator and thinker of the Meiji period and the Taisho period.

sen.j: 幼名は謙次郎。
sen.e: His childhood name was Kenjiro.
His childhood name was Kenjiro.
His childhood name was Kenjiro.

sen.j: 父は膳所藩の儒者杉浦重文。
sen.e: His father, Jubun SUGIURA, was a Confucian in the Zeze Domain.
His father, Jubun SUGIURA, was a Confucian in the Zeze Domain.
His father, Jubun SUGIURA, was a Confucian in the Zeze Domain.

sen.j: 近江国膳所藩（現・滋賀県大津市）出身。
sen.e: He was from Zeze Domain in Omi Province (now Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture).
He was from the Zeze Domain in Omi Province (present Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture).
He was from the Zeze Domain in Omi Province (present Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture).

sen.j: 若き日の昭和天皇、秩父宮雍仁親王、高松宮宣仁親王の3兄弟に帝王学の一環として倫理を進講する。
sen.e: He gave a lecture on ethics as a part of the studies required for an emperor to the three brothers of the imperial family: young Emperor Showa, Chichibunomiya Imperial Prince Yasuhito and Takamatsunomiya Imperial Prince Yoshihito.

He gave a lecture on ethics as a part of the studies required for an emperor to the three brothers of the imperial family: young Emperor Showa, Chichibunomiya Imperial Prince Yasuhito and Takamatsunomiya Imperial Prince Yoshihito.

He gave a lecture on ethics as a part of the studies required for an emperor to the three brothers of the imperial family: young Emperor Showa, Chichibunomiya Imperial Prince Yasuhito and Takamatsunomiya Imperial Prince Yoshihito.

sen.j: 号は梅窓または天台道士。
sen.e: His title was Baiso or Tendai-doshi.
He called himself Baiso or Tendai-doshi.
He called himself Baiso or Tendai-doshi.

sen.j: 学生時の渾名は紙魚（しみ）。
sen.e: He had a nickname "book warm" when he was a student.
He had a nickname, Shimi (book warm), when he was a student.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: He had a nickname, Shimi (book warm), when he was a student.

sen.j: 後に「人格高邁の国士」と評される。
sen.e: Later, he was called "a man of noble character in Japan."
Later, he was called 'patriot of noble character.'
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。「国士」は日本の男ではなく「憂国の士」「愛国者」のことです。
sen.e: Later, he was called 'patriot of noble character.'

sen.j: 理学宗の世界観を確立。
sen.e: He established a view of the world from a scientific perspective.
He established the idea of Rigakushu (his idea of applying schience to every matter).
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。「理学宗」は彼が唱えた謎の思想なので、他の宗教、思想と混同されないようにします。
sen.e: He established the idea of Rigakushu (his idea of applying schience to every matter).

sen.j: 近江国膳所藩の儒者で父杉浦重文（蕉亭）と母八重の次男として生まれる。
sen.e: Born as the second son of father Jubun (Shotei) SUGIURA, a Confucian of Zeze Domain in Omi Province, and mother Yae.
He was born as the second son of Jubun (Shotei) SUGIURA, a Confucian serving the Zeze clan in Omi Province, and his wife Yae.
sen.cmt: スタイルを統一します。
sen.e: He was born as the second son of Jubun (Shotei) SUGIURA, a Confucian serving the Zeze clan in Omi Province, and his wife Yae.

sen.j: 数え年6歳で藩校・遵義堂に入学を許され、高橋担堂、黒田麹盧、岩垣月洲に漢学洋学を学ぶ。
sen.e: At the age of 5, he was allowed to enter a domain school named Songido, and learned Chinese classics and Western studies from Tando TAKAHASHI, Kikuro (麹盧) KURODA and Gesshu (月洲) IWAGAKI.
sen.cmt: 「数え年6歳」は、年号と同じように、実年齢（5歳）にしてあります。 ［正しい読み方が不明です］
sen.e: At the age of 6 (in Japanese counting, it was 5 years old), he was allowed to enter a domain school named Songido, and learned Chinese classics and Western studies from Tando TAKAHASHI, Kikuro KURODA and Gesshu IWAGAKI.

At the age of 6 (in Japanese counting, it was 5 years old), he was allowed to enter a domain school named Songido, and learned Chinese classics and Western studies from Tando TAKAHASHI, Kikuro KURODA and Gesshu IWAGAKI.

sen.j: "予の精神は之を担堂先生に受け、学問は之を麹盧先生に受け、識見は之を月洲先生に受けた"と後に懐述するように、この三人より受けた教育的感化は彼の一生を支える程強かった。
sen.e: Educational influence from the three teachers was strong enough to support him for life as he recalled later that "his sprit had been influenced by Mr. Tando, his studies by Mr. Kikuro (麹盧), and his knowledge by Mr. Gesshu (月洲)."
sen.cmt: ［正しい読み方が不明です］ 先生の名前は、名字の方が良いと思われます。
sen.e: Educational influence from the three teachers was strong enough to support him for life as he recalled later that "I received sprit from Mr. Tando, studies from Mr. Kikuro, and knowledge from Mr. Gesshu."
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。引用なので「予」はそのまま「I」。
sen.e: Educational influence from the three teachers was strong enough to support him for life as he recalled later that "I received sprit from Mr. Tando, studies from Mr. Kikuro, and knowledge from Mr. Gesshu."

sen.j: 15歳で句読方に任ぜられる。
sen.e: At the age of 15, he was appointed to a teacher of Chinese classics.
sen.cmt: 「句読方(漢文教師)」で訳してあります。
sen.e: At the age of 15, he was appointed instructor of Chinese classics reading.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: At the age of 15, he was appointed instructor of Chinese classics reading.

sen.j: 15歳のおり藩より貢進生に選ばれ東京に下り、大学南校に学ぶ。
sen.e: When he was 15 years old, he went to Tokyo to study at Daigaku Nanko (predecessor of the University of Tokyo) as a student recommended by the domain.
sen.cmt: 「貢進生（こうしんせい）とは、1870年（明治3年）に各藩からの推薦を受けて大学南校に入学した生徒のこと」を参考に英訳しました。
sen.e: When he was 15 years old, he went to Tokyo to study at Daigaku Nanko (predecessor of the University of Tokyo) as a student recommended by the clan.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: When he was 15 years old, he went to Tokyo to study at Daigaku Nanko (predecessor of the University of Tokyo) as a student recommended by the clan.

sen.j: 在学中は猛勉強の結果、1873年（明治6年）10月、明治天皇への御前講演に選ばれ理化学の実験を行う。
sen.e: As a result of his hard work at the university, he was selected to conduct physical and chemical experiments in front of Meiji Emperor during the lecture in October 1873.
As a result of his hard work at the school, in October 1873 he was selected to the lecture in front of Emperor Meiji and conducted experiments of physics and chemistry.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: As a result of his hard work at the school, in October 1873 he was selected to the lecture in front of Emperor Meiji and conducted experiments of physics and chemistry.

sen.j: 1876年（明治9年）、第2回文部省派遣留学生に選抜されて渡欧。
sen.e: In 1876, he went to Europe as a student dispatched by the Ministry of Education secondly.
In 1876, he was selected as a student overseas of the second dispatch by the Ministry of Education, and went to Europe.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: In 1876, he was selected as a student overseas of the second dispatch by the Ministry of Education, and went to Europe.

sen.j: 化学を専攻。
sen.e: He majored in chemistry.
He majored in chemistry.
He majored in chemistry.

sen.j: 当初は農業を修めるつもりでサイレンシスター農学校に入るが、英国の農業は牧畜が中心で、穀物は麦で、勉強をしても帰国後役には立たないと気付き放棄した。
sen.e: At first, he entered the agricultural college in Cirencester to study agriculture, but he gave up this idea, knowing that studies in Britain, where stock farming centered agriculture with a focus on wheat among grains, would not be of any help in Japan.
sen.cmt: サイレンシスター農学校で検索してもヒットしません。唯一関連があるのは、CirencesterにあるRoyal Agricultural Collegeです。そのため、サイレンシスターにある農学校としました。
sen.e: At first, he entered the agricultural college in Cirencester to study agriculture, however he gave up this idea, knowing that the major agriculture of Britain was stock farming and the major grain was wheat, and that the studies of those things would be useless in Japan.

At first, he entered the agricultural college in Cirencester to study agriculture, however he gave up this idea, knowing that the major agriculture of Britain was stock farming and the major grain was wheat, and that the studies of those things would be useless in Japan.

sen.j: 化学に転向し、マンチェスター・オーエンスカレッジに移り、ロスコー、ショーレマン両教授の指導下で研究に従事。
sen.e: To study chemistry instead, he transferred to Owens College, Manchester, where he devoted himself to research under the direction of Professor Roscoe and Professor Showreman (ショーレマン).
To study chemistry instead, he transferred to Owens College, Manchester, where he devoted himself to research under the direction of Professor Roscoe and Professor Sholeman.
sen.cmt: 「ショーレマン」不明。「sholeman」の方がメジャーで日本人がショーレマンと読みそうです。
sen.e: To study chemistry instead, he transferred to Owens College, Manchester, where he devoted himself to research under the direction of Professor Roscoe and Professor Sholeman.

sen.j: 更にロンドンのサウスケンジントン化学校、ロンドン大学等で学ぶうちに神経衰弱にかかり、1880年（明治13年）5月に帰国。
sen.e: While studying further at the College of Chemistry at South Kensington, London and the University of London, he had a nervous breakdown, and returned to Japan in May 1880.
sen.cmt: "In 1872-3 the College of Chemistry moved into a new building at South Kensington"とあり、the Royal College of Chemistryが正式名称です。
sen.e: While studying further at the College of Chemistry at South Kensington, London and the University of London, he had a nervous breakdown, and returned to Japan in May 1880.
While studying further at the College of Chemistry at South Kensington, London and the University of London, he had a nervous breakdown, and returned to Japan in May 1880.

sen.j: 27歳で文部省と東京大学に勤める。
sen.e: At the age of 27, he worked for the Ministry of Education and the University of Tokyo.
At the age of 27, he worked for the Ministry of Education and the University of Tokyo.
At the age of 27, he worked for the Ministry of Education and the University of Tokyo.

sen.j: その間、東大予備門（のちの第一高等学校 (旧制)）校長にあり、また大学予備門など旧制高校進学のために英語でもって教授する予備校であった東京英語学校（のちすぐに日本学園中学校・高等学校に改称）創立の中心の一人となる。
sen.e: In the mean time, he became the principal of Preparatory School for the University of Tokyo (later the First Senior High School [under the old education system]), and a member for the foundation of Tokyo English School (soon changed its name to Nihon Gakuen Junior and Senior High School), a preparatory school teaching in English to enter old-education-system high schools including preparatory schools for universities.
sen.cmt: 日本語に説明が多いため、日本語表記と英訳の並列は、やめました。分かりやすく、すべて意味を取って訳してあります。
sen.e: In the mean time, he became the principal of Preparatory School for the University of Tokyo (later the First Senior High School [under the old education system]), and a member for the foundation of Tokyo English School (soon changed its name to Nihon Gakuen Junior and Senior High School), a preparatory school teaching in English to enter old-education-system high schools including preparatory schools for universities.

In the mean time, he became the principal of Preparatory School for the University of Tokyo (later the First Senior High School [under the old education system]), and a member for the foundation of Tokyo English School (soon changed its name to Nihon Gakuen Junior and Senior High School), a preparatory school teaching in English to enter old-education-system high schools including preparatory schools for universities.

sen.j: のちに、読売新聞・朝日新聞の社説を担当となり、三宅雪嶺、志賀重昂らと政教社発行の「日本人」（のちに「日本及び日本人」）や日本 (新聞)の刊行に力を尽くす。
sen.e: Later, he was in charge of editorials in the two newspapers of the Yomiuri Shimbun and the Asahi Shimbun, and put effort into publishing "Nipponjin" (Japanese people) from Seikyo Sha and "Nippon" (newspaper) (later also a magazine titled "Nippon oyobi Nipponjin" [Japan and its people]) together with Setsurei MIYAKE and Shigetaka SHIGA.
sen.cmt: 「三宅雪嶺が主宰した『日本及び日本人』という雑誌」とあるので、そのように英訳してあります。
sen.e: Later, he was in charge of editorials in the two newspapers of the Yomiuri Shimbun and the Asahi Shimbun; and together with Setsurei MIYAKE and Shigetaka SHIGA, he put effort into publishing "Nipponjin" (Japanese people, later changed its name to "Nippon oyobi Nipponjin" [Japan and Japanese]) and "Nippon" (newspaper), both had been published by Seikyo-sha.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミス、誤訳があります。
sen.e: Later, he was in charge of editorials in the two newspapers of the Yomiuri Shimbun and the Asahi Shimbun; and together with Setsurei MIYAKE and Shigetaka SHIGA, he put effort into publishing "Nipponjin" (Japanese people, later changed its name to "Nippon oyobi Nipponjin" [Japan and Japanese]) and "Nippon" (newspaper), both had been published by Seikyo-sha.

sen.j: それらによって国粋主義を主張し、当時の社会に影響を波及させる。
sen.e: Through these means, he advocated nationalism, which influenced the society at that time.
Through these means, he advocated nationalism, which influenced the society at that time.
Through these means, he advocated nationalism, which influenced the society at that time.

sen.j: 1889年（明治22年）には日本倶楽部をつくり、大隈重信の不平等条約改正案に反対する。
sen.e: Organizing the Japan Club in 1889, he opposed the draft to revise unequal treaties formulated by Shigenobu OKUMA.
Organizing the Japan Club in 1889, he opposed the draft to revise unequal treaties formulated by Shigenobu OKUMA.
Organizing the Japan Club in 1889, he opposed the draft to revise unequal treaties formulated by Shigenobu OKUMA.

sen.j: 小石川議員を経て、翌年1890年（明治22年）第1回衆議院議員総選挙に大成会から出馬し当選。
sen.e: After serving as a Koishikawa assembly member, he ran in the first general election for the House of Representatives from Taisei-kai Party to be elected.
After serving as assembly member of Koishikawa Ward, the next year, in 1890, he ran in the first general election for the House of Representatives from Taisei-kai Party to be elected.
After serving as assembly member of Koishikawa Ward, the next year, in 1890, he ran in the first general election for the House of Representatives from Taisei-kai Party to be elected.

sen.j: しかし翌年に辞職した。
sen.e: However, he resigned in 1891.
However, he resigned in 1891.
However, he resigned in 1891.

sen.j: その後は子弟の養成と共に東京文学院を設立し、以後も國學院大學学監や東亜同文書院院長、東宮御学問所御用掛などを歴任。
sen.e: Then, he founded Tokyo Bungakuin College while fostering young people, and assumed a series of posts of the dean of Kokugakuin University, the president of Toa-Dobunshoin University, and a national officer serving at the study office for the crown prince.
sen.cmt: 「御学問所があります。その名のとおり、天皇の御学問の為の建物で、今で言うなら書斎か勉強部屋」 「御用掛：宮内庁長官が任命する非常勤の国家公務員。専門的な知識や経験を生かして、皇室に奉仕する人」を参考に訳してあります。
sen.e: Then, he founded Tokyo Bungakuin College while teaching young people, and assumed a series of posts of the dean of Kokugakuin University, the president of Toa-Dobunshoin University, and instructor of the school for crown prince.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。他の記事に登場する様々な「御用掛」にいちいちnationalと説明を加えていないはずなので、普通に訳します。
sen.e: Then, he founded Tokyo Bungakuin College while teaching young people, and assumed a series of posts of the dean of Kokugakuin University, the president of Toa-Dobunshoin University, and instructor of the school for crown prince.

sen.j: 官学崇拝も強く、当時の官公立中等教育のメッカである府立一中にも足を運び、「本校は帝都の第一中学であるのみならず、帝国の第一中学である」など講演にても国家の権威を高めることに尽力していた。
sen.e: Strongly public education-oriented, he put much effort into enhancing the authority of the state by visiting the Tokyo Prefectural First Junior High School, the center of the secondary public education at that time in order to give a lecture, where he said, "This school is the first junior high school not only in the imperial capital but also in the empire."

He was also a strong adorer of education by national school (present public school in Japan), and put much effort into enhancing the authority of the state, as he even visited the Tokyo Prefectural First Junior High School, the mecca of secondary education by national school in those days, and lectured, "This school is the first junior high school not only in the imperial capital but also in the empire."
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。当時の「官学」は国によって方針が決められている、国が運営する学校の教育という狭い意味です。
sen.e: He was also a strong adorer of education by national school (present public school in Japan), and put much effort into enhancing the authority of the state, as he even visited the Tokyo Prefectural First Junior High School, the mecca of secondary education by national school in those days, and lectured, "This school is the first junior high school not only in the imperial capital but also in the empire."

sen.j: 迪宮裕仁親王（摂政宮、のちの昭和天皇）の御進講役も勤め、さらに宮中某重大事件にては久邇宮家と結んで、山縣有朋に対抗した。
sen.e: Giving lectures to Michinomiya Prince Hirohito (Prince Regent, later Emperor Showa) as a scholar, he was in opposition to Ariake YAMAGATA uniting with the Kuninomiya family for a certain serious incident caused at court.

He gave lectures to Michinomiya Imperial Prince Hirohito (Prince Regent, later Emperor Showa) as scholar, and at a certain serious incident in the Imperial Palace, he cooperated with the Kuninomiya family against Ariake YAMAGATA.
sen.cmt: 用語を統一、わかりやすくします。
sen.e: He gave lectures to Michinomiya Imperial Prince Hirohito (Prince Regent, later Emperor Showa) as scholar, and at a certain serious incident in the Imperial Palace, he cooperated with the Kuninomiya family against Ariake YAMAGATA.

sen.j: 1924年（大正13年）死去。
sen.e: He died in 1924.
He died in 1924.
